properties.name: Cobblestone Creek development
properties.description: Posted by Ecocritique 9564 Cobblestone Creek Dr, Boynton Beach, FloridaResidents of this development have filed suit because Chinese drywall has been used in the construction of their homes. The drywall has been linked to health issues and damage to internal parts of the homes like the A/C\'s copper tubing. The U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission has documented almost 1200 reports of the defective drywall in the U.S.

properties.name: Genzyme center
properties.description: Posted by Ecocritique 500 Kendall Street. Cambridge, MA 02142The Genzyme center was built in 2005 and has LEED Platinum status. It uses heliostats to reflect natural light into this huge atrium, saving almost 50% electricity. The building as created by Behnisch, Behnisch and Partner, of Stuttgart, Germany.

properties.name: JFK Airport TWA flight center Jet Blue terminal 5
properties.description: Posted by Ecocritique The only thing green about the new terminal @ JFK airport is the green parking lot code (which really isn\'t green either). You\'d expect that a prominent airline like Jet Blue would invest some of the money we give wisely. Wisely enough to put up some alternative energy source or energy saving devices. The new terminal should be an example of how corp. America can change the way we do business. Efficiency should be their main focus. With that comes convenience.

properties.name: Masdar City
properties.description: Posted by EcocritiqueFuture zero carbon, zero waste city on the outskirts of Abu Dhabi. Funded by Mubadala Development Co. Pedicted to have 50,000 people and 1,500 hundred businesses. Masdar mens "The Source" in Arabic.

properties.name: Scripps jupiter
properties.description: Posted by Ecocritique several square ft. of building insulation under a palm tree @ hole #10 of the disc golf course. NW corner of the Scripps fountain. photo coming soon http://www.scripps.edu/intro/flamaps.html http://www.scripps.edu/contact.phtml

properties.name: Syracuse Hancock international airport
properties.description: Posted by Ecocritique 1000 Colonel Eileen Collins Boulevard Syracuse, NY 13212According to the airports info site the new airport will include: Green design and construction techniques that will significantly reduce operating costs for the building and reduce the building’s carbon footprint. Proposed techniques include solar panels to produce electricity and hot water; construction techniques that minimize waste and encourage recycling; extensive use of natural daylighting; enhanced indoor environmental quality; and the use of sustainable construction materials. The use of green technology combined with the installation of more energy-efficient HVAC equipment is estimated to reduce terminal operating and maintenance costs by as much as .00 per square foot per year. In addition to this new design concept the airport has already implemented a recycling program that seems pretty nice. The quick hand dryers in the bathrooms need to be located better so that they are easier to use.

properties.name: prairie creek
properties.description: Posted by Ecocritique nice creek with light current down stream from the lake. meandering along you will see deer, gator, turtles, and a large variety of birds. creek is murky but seems to be mostly clean the further from the road you get.
